results.title: Mammals and their characteristics
results.brief_description: What do the anteater and the seal have in common? They both have some kind of hair and nurse their young. When vertebrates have these two characteristics, they are classified as mammals. The great diversity of mammals is illustrated by representative members of the major groups - carnivores, rodents, ungulates, marsupials and primates.

results.title: Mammals and milk
results.brief_description: Shows that mammals are all alike in the respect that they produce milk to feed their young. Also useful in early sex education and to stimulate language arts discussion. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Mammals
results.brief_description: Identifies through both common and uncommon examples, those chracteristics that set mammals apart from all other animals. Also shows that household pets may be relatives of large, wild animals. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Mammals
results.brief_description: Presents an early art film by Roman Polanski without dialogue. Shows two men with one sled, tramping through the snow and each trying to out manoeuvre the other in order to ride on the sled. Cast features Henryka Klube and Michala Zolnierziewicza.

results.title: Mamma Roma
results.creator_credit: Alfredo Bini, Arco Film (Italy), Cineriz and Pier Pasolini
results.brief_description: Mamma Roma (Anna Magnani in a truly magnificent performance) is a prostitute hoping to go straight. At the beginning of the film she sees off her pimp, gets herself a market stall, and fetches her teenage son home from the country. But her idyll does not last. The pimp keeps coming back, trying to force her back on the game, her son is unable to hold down a job and when he discovers his mother’s past he drifts into petty crime with tragic results. While very moving and at times disturbing, Pasolini’s story is imbued with a feeling that the world can be someway other than it is and that the deep splits in human nature produced by a failed civilisation can somehow be transcended. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Mamie & Maggie
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Eulea Kiraly and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eulea Kiraly pays tribute to her grandmothers Maggie and Mamie, who are a source of comfort, inspiration and resilience. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Tuggeranong Arts Centre.

results.title: Mame
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, ABC-TV (Australia), Robert Fryer, James Cresson and Gene Saks
results.brief_description: Lucille Ball’s last film, “Mame” is a fantasy romp through the twenties: a time of Prohibition, the Depression and Grand Tours of the world on luxury liners. “Mame” is a musical feast featuring such songs as “My Best Girl” and “We Need a Little Christmas.” Auntie Mame is a larger than life character who parties her way through life in the charge of her orphaned nephew. Based on the award winning Broadway musical.

results.title: Mambush: the craftsman and the artist
results.creator_credit: Jerry A Callner and Callner Film Productions
results.brief_description: Master craftsman Yitzhak Mambush describes and demonstrates the results of blending of the painters and tapestry maker’s talents. Visiting the artistic community of Ein Hod, Israel, where Mambush works, the process of preparing for weaving is shown. Mambush characterises his translation of the painters art into a tapestry as not simply a reprise of the canvas.

results.title: Mama Tina
results.creator_credit: Gumleaf Productions, December Films, Steve Jeffares and Stuart Menzies
results.brief_description: Irish mother Christina Noble has a special identity to the homeless children of Vietnam, she is known as Mama Tina. Driven by her grim childhood in Dublin, Christina moves through the streets and rubbish dumps in search of lost children. The stories related to and filmed by writer-director Steve Jeffares about Mama Tina are a testament to her love for children and her philosophy that all children are entitled to education, health care and love.

results.title: Maltese Flamingo
results.brief_description: A wonderfully wild’n’wacky ski film taking top honours at Vail’s ski film festival. Follow the adventures of 12 ski bums as they take on some of the greatest ski terrain in Europe and North America. Incredible ski action, great music gives `Maltese Flamingo’ the necessary punch to be one of the classic ski films of all time. Rated: G
